summary: ICE oversees—and in some cases provides—medical care for people detained in its facilities. Some care is provided onsite and some must be provided offsite, such as at a hospital. ICE must obtain documentation of "informed consent" from people receiving onsite care. Informed consent involves the medical provider speaking to the person in detail about treatment risks, benefits, and alternatives. Medical files that we reviewed generally...
title: Immigration Detention: ICE Needs to Strengthen Oversight of Informed Consent for Medical Care
